question: 使用
sourceMnemonic:
Something you <kanji>use</kanji> that has a <kanji>use</kanji> has... well, <vocabulary>use</vocabulary>. You can even use it for practical <vocabulary>application</vocabulary>s.

<ja>使用</ja> has a slightly more formal tone compared to <ja>使う</ja>, and it’s preferred in situations that require a more precise and less casual choice of words.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
